quote: Together, these characters discover the ideas of faith and fellowship as the film congratulates itself on its noble instincts.

quote: [The film] improves as it goes along.
title: Risky Business

quote: [A] surprisingly charming film, which may be the first Christmas black comedy for children.

quote: Although it is full of noise and fake firepower, Dredd simply lies there on the screen until the final scenes.

quote: What a pack of trashy people these accomplished actors perform!

quote: Excellent quasidocumentary, which sends shivers down the spine while moving the viewer to ponder.

quote: Gremlins is far more interested in showing off its knowledge of movie lore and making random jokes than in providing consistent entertainment.

quote: "Carlito's Way" is best watched as lively, colorful posturing and as a fine demonstration of this director's bravura visual style.

quote: The Baby-Sitters Club is like an average installment of the series, aimed at girls who can't get enough of their fictional friends in any form.

quote: There is beauty in Kagemusha but it is impersonal, distant and ghostly. The old master has never been more rigorous.

quote: The actors try hard, but the screenplay isn't solid enough to keep any of them consistently clever.

quote: If you've ever had a yen to relive the third grade, this must be the next best thing.

quote: There may be a sober moment or two in the picture; there may be a few lines of the script that do not pack a laugh. Somehow we cannot remember them.

quote: One of the sprightliest comedies of the year.

quote: The material has been successfully refurbished with new jokes and new attitudes, but the earlier film's most memorable moments have been preserved.

quote: Richard Benjamin, laboring under the idea that this is an enchanting premise, directs such episodes as if he were Norman Rockwell in a trenchcoat.

quote: It stays so wickedly close to the subject that it is very nearly indistinguishable from the real thing.

quote: Giant, for all its complexity, is a strong contender for the year's top-film award.

quote: [It] has the dubious distinction of calling attention to just about everything the play isn't, and was never meant to be.

quote: The Superman series gets more and more whimsically outrageous as it goes along.

quote: To say it is callous and macabre is understating the case.

title: Shichinin no samurai

quote: If Mr. Friedkin didn't have to work so strenuously framing two-shots of Mr. Nolte with this seven-foot athlete, it might be hard to remember that Mr. O'Neal has a day job.

quote: A charming entertainment.

quote: The spectacular fire sequences, which must have been hellish to film, are powerfully enveloping on screen, thanks especially to the eerie effect of the title.

quote: The picture on the whole is close to being a top-drawer mystery.

quote: [Let us] heartily proclaim that it is the freshest little picture in a long time, and maybe even the best comedy of this year.

quote: An ambitious, tough, seriously considered biographical film that, with honor, eludes easy characterization.

quote: Disappointingly colorless and squeaky-clean.

quote: The movie is stuffed with cues for arias that are never heard.

quote: It's a film that a lot of other directors will wish they'd had the brilliance to make.

quote: The physical production is as lush as the film's romantic longings.

quote: An altogether brilliant film, haunting, suspenseful, handsome and handsomely played.

quote: Small, searing film.

quote: The film's aimlessness and repetitiveness eventually become draining.

quote: As free in form as it is generous of spirit.

quote: Played with great magnetism and triumphant bluster by Liam Neeson, the film's Michael Collins easily lives up to his nickname.

quote: Cliffhanger, the new high-altitude thriller starring Sylvester Stallone, wastes no time in establishing its first priority, that of sending its audience into a cold sweat.

quote: Airplane! is more than a pleasant surprise, in the midst of this dim movie season. As a remedy for the bloated self-importance of too many other current efforts, it's just what the doctor ordered.

quote: Leave your preconceptions about fishing at the door: you'll be caught hook, line and sinker.

quote: The plot is deliberately perfunctory, the people deliciously perverse, and the mise-en-scene radical.

quote: Costner hasn't been this charming and spontaneous for years.

quote: One of the great musicals.

quote: A beautifully animated Disney feature.

quote: The movie remains a great tonic.
title: Roman Holiday

quote: It's brave, adventurous, refreshingly frank -- qualities also marking the performances, particularly those of the leads.

quote: While he can fling together a competent action or special effects sequence, his handling of the plot and actors is strictly routine.
title: Virus

quote: Rowdy stuff for the light in head.
title: Scrooged

quote: The film is far too slick to be ineffective, but its attempts to play with the sex-war theme are often unbelievably crass.

quote: A masterpiece.
title: The Manchurian Candidate

quote: It's certainly one of the finest comedies ever to come out of Paramount.

quote: There are some great supporting performances, and much of the dialogue has become history.

quote: The light comedy is sweetly timed, the direction smart and assured, and the visuals bright, colourful, unobtrusive and faultless.

quote: An over-long and only spasmodically amusing romantic comedy...

quote: Stiller's film ranks as an honourable failure.

quote: It's like a meal consisting of cheesecake, and one quickly longs for something solid and vulgar to weigh things down.

quote: The story is risible, the direction routine, the underlying ethic highly questionable; but the flying stirs the blood like speed.

title: The Fog

quote: Stone's eye-blistering images possess an awesome power, which sets the senses reeling and leaves the mind disturbed.

quote: This is one of the great movie adventures, fully deserving its canonisation in Disney World.
title: 20000 Leagues Under the Sea

quote: Part romantic comedy, part Capra-corny political drama, this movie exudes so much sympathy, it sweats.

quote: Immaculately performed, and assembled with wit and sensitivity, this is one of the most satisfying weepies in years.

quote: The film looks good and has its funny moments, but too often one senses Anderson straining to impress...

title: Sunset Blvd.

quote: Mediocre, regrettably.
title: Grumpy Old Men

quote: Stronger on mores than amore, a half smile for a summer night.

quote: What more can one say about this much-loved, much discussed blockbuster?
title: Gone with the Wind

quote: The climax, in particular, manages to be more than just a shoot-out, with Fleischer's intelligent direction generating a real feeling of chaos and apocalypse.

quote: One of Wilder's funniest satires.
title: Some Like It Hot

quote: A pioneering film, in both senses of the word, and one of the key works in the American cinema of the 1970s.

quote: Smoothly constructed, for such a busy piece of work, and Hatcher's ascent to stardom continues.

title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail

quote: Director O'Haver fails to supply any proper shape or development.
title: Get Over It

quote: A crude piece of work, spottily acted and directed.

quote: It doesn't so much champion diversity as celebrate conformity.
title: The Birdcage

quote: It's a bit like a Woody Allen film without the kvetching or the wisecracks, but younger and more vital.

quote: Slicker than crude oil and just as unattractive.

quote: Conjures up a dazzling, futuristic cityscape that, sadly, is not matched by the human landscapes at the heart of the story.
title: Kôkaku kidôtai

quote: Fake countdown and knowing reactionary tone, but the best SF car chase to date.

quote: Ambitious, sensitive, but ultimately uninvolving.
title: Jude

quote: [An] aimless movie.
title: Howard the Duck

quote: Although this slick Seagal action pic won't convert die-hard detractors, aficionados will note that he's both gained weight and lightened up.

quote: Magic.
title: Born Yesterday

quote: 'Herbie' and his plucky stunt drivers steal the show in this agreeable family entertainment.

quote: The ending, despite good intentions, is American cinema at its tackiest and most hollow.

quote: It's what Hollywood wanted Woo for: bigger, brighter explosions.

quote: Uniquely weird, subtly macabre, and utterly compelling.

quote: Superior disposable comedy.

quote: Wryly and delightfully witty.
title: La collectionneuse

quote: For hardcore Van Damme and Sparks fans only.

quote: Unendurable.

title: Tsubaki Sanjûrô

quote: The answer should have made a great thriller, but the film is sunk by a series of preposterous performances.

quote: A thoroughly enjoyable blend of comedy and melodrama...

quote: One of the most enthralling and exhilarating American movies in ages.

quote: You won't believe your eyes.

quote: It's a film-maker's love letter to himself.

quote: The film is grounded in genuine emotions and its knowing humour serves it well. I laughed like a drain.

quote: ...a throwback to the kind of serious, literate drama Hollywood used to make.

quote: Good fun.
title: The Muppet Christmas Carol

quote: Deja Vu attempts to explain the 'science' behind the movie's time-jumping, but in a drama that's contemporary and supposedly realistic, it comes off as cockamamie.
title: Deja Vu

quote: Definition of redundant: A formulaic Hollywood pic that calls itself Deja Vu.
title: Deja Vu

quote: What gives the film its jolt of urgency is its New Orleans setting. Deja Vu is the first major movie to be shot there since the city's devastation.
title: Deja Vu

quote: The movie manages the singular feat of placing a science-fiction premise in a realistic setting, only to render that premise even more far-fetched than it would have seemed otherwise.
title: Deja Vu

quote: Pretty dazzling, as action adventures go, even when it's wildly, almost defiantly, implausible.
title: Deja Vu

quote: Director Joel Schumacher aims for a psychological depth that the script can't sustain.
title: 8MM

quote: The fleetingly satisfying Deja Vu is ultimately a self-fulfilling prophecy.
title: Deja Vu

quote: Nobody looks cooler walking in slow motion through a crime scene while wearing sunglasses than Denzel Washington -- but even the great Denzel can't save Deja Vu.
title: Deja Vu

quote: Part gritty prison drama, part inner-city chronicle, the energetic Slam defies easy categorization, serving as a compelling plea for black males of how to survive in oppressive society. The film won the 1998 Sundance Jury Award for Best Drama.
title: Slam

title: She's So Lovely

quote: I felt cheated.
title: Deja Vu

quote: More than 40 years old, Francois Truffaut's whirling dervish remains an ageless beauty.
title: Jules et Jim

quote: I'd call this the best American movie about returning soldiers I've ever seen -- the most moving and the most deeply felt.
title: The Best Years of Our Lives

quote: Today it's less impressive but not without its virtues.
title: The Lost Weekend

quote: The most famous and perhaps most effective propaganda film of World War II.

quote: This is Capra at his best, very funny and very light, with a minimum of populist posturing.

quote: Expert performances from Donald Crisp, Walter Pidgeon, Maureen O'Hara, and a host of brilliant character actors enhance a magnificent movie experience.
title: How Green Was My Valley

quote: This act of altruism on behalf of the brothers Warner was rewarded with the best picture Oscar for 1937; it isn't so much bad as utterly, magisterially bland.

quote: It's tainted by a fair amount of middlebrow stuffiness, but it's a fleet piece of storytelling and serves to enshrine one of the great ham performances of all time, Charles Laughton's Captain Bligh.

quote: It won best-picture Oscar for 1952, but God (De Mille's favorite walk-on, strangely absent here) only knows why.
title: The Greatest Show on Earth

quote: A critic-proof movie if there ever was one: it isn't all that good, but somehow it's great.
title: Gone with the Wind

quote: Less effective as a movie than as a dazzling parade of star iconography.

quote: Every audience sniffle and tear has been taken into account.

quote: The story is spellbinding, the acting lusty and the spectacle everything you could expect from a Golden Age MGM production -- though sometimes it's a bit too much on the monumental side.

quote: Despite the fitful energy and the beauty of the settings, the ugliness of the mise en scene and the crudity of the editing tend to triumph.

quote: I wanted to like it more than I did, but it'll do.
title: Rocky

quote: Misogynistic claptrap.
title: Kramer vs. Kramer

quote: A decent piece of do-good cinema.

quote: Visually and structurally it's a mess, but many of the situations are genuinely clever, and there are plenty of memorable gags.

quote: Lerner and Loewe's musical masterwork, reimagined for film by director George Cukor.

quote: The ultimate family film.

quote: Francis Ford Coppola pulls it off in grand style.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: [It] remains one of the most intelligent, handsome, and influential of all war epics.

quote: Entire new frontiers in boredom were opened up by this MGM whopper from 1959.

title: It's My Party

title: Charlotte's Web

quote: "Some pig?" Sure. Some spider. And some book. Some movie, too.
title: Charlotte's Web

quote: Charlotte's Web, with its insistently 'magical' theme music, an overbearing climax and a trough full of bad jokes, is merely adequate.
title: Charlotte's Web

quote: The ads promise magic, but apart from the requisite heart-tugging finale, what it delivers is uneventful.
title: Charlotte's Web

quote: It's a movie so modest and gentle, you'll hear your neighbour's popcorn crunch. But you may also hear your heart beating. And there's nothing wrong with that.
title: Charlotte's Web

quote: The film, directed by Gary Winick (13 Going on 30) has a sweetness of its own.
title: Charlotte's Web

quote: Charlotte's Web, a splendid new screen adaptation of White's 1952 children's book, gloriously brings the classic to life. If you've never read it, this is a perfect introduction.
title: Charlotte's Web

quote: The movie may not be perfect, but it beautifully distills White's simple message. We are all born to die. But we are also born to befriend.
title: Charlotte's Web

quote: Charlotte's Web adapts a classic, which is not to say it is one.
title: Charlotte's Web

quote: Best of all may be the narration, by Sam Shepard: His voice, the kind of voice God might have if he'd ever smoked Camels, frames this gentle but potent little story with good-natured authority, making it feel modern and ageless at once.

quote: Unfortunately, Charlotte's Web is an unremarkable collection of cute kids, talking animals and syrupy sentiment. There's little of White's original spare style and even less to entertain anyone but the very undemanding.

quote: The battered Britons may have some excuse for enjoying this nostalgic re-creation of empire ideology, but what's ours?

quote: Bloated adaptation of P.D. James's thoughtful, compact novel.

title: That Thing You Do!

quote: [A] dark, terrifying and sometimes very funny film.
title: Children of Men

quote: A stylish mish-mash of dystopian cliches.

quote: Darkly poetic throughout, the film starts with an explosion and ends drifting in fog with no clear resolution in sight. How brave and oddly satisfying.

quote: Fasten your seat belt; you're in for a bumpy, provocative ride.

quote: The result is completely intoxicating.

quote: It has its moments, but not many, and generally speaking it runs neck and neck with Dune as the least successful and interesting Lynch feature.

title: West Side Story

quote: A pretty watchable and always interesting period film, well photographed by English cinematographer Freddie Francis.

quote: I can't say I remembered this 1995 feature too clearly a couple of days later; but I certainly had a good time as I watched it.

quote: The film may have been intended as an ironic comment on the absurdity of human ambition, but it's an irony that explodes in Herzog's face.

title: Yôjinbô

quote: The wit is too weak to sustain a film, and the songs all sound the same.

quote: This is the real thing, and real things don't come along very often, so you'd better snap them up when they do.
